tool_description: Go Hackers provides hackernews posts data faster than other APIs with detailed information, for most of the categories like topstories, newstories, beststories.
name: Go HackerNews
title: Go HackerNews

api_list.name: Get Job Stories
api_list.description: Using this api you can get the detailed information of job stories on hackernews.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/jobstories/200"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/jobstories/{limit}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get New Stories
api_list.description: Using new stories you can get hackernews new posts.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: Limit is required and your limit can't be more than 500

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/newstories/500"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Top Stories
api_list.description: Using this api you can get the detailed information of top stories on hackernews.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: The default limit set by official api of hackernews is 500 so you can't pass limit more than 500.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/topstories/500"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "go-hackernews.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
